info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 6:48PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern McDowell, central Rutherford, southeastern Transylvania, Henderson, Polk, southeastern Buncombe, northern Greenville, northwestern Spartanburg and northern Pickens Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 647 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Downtown Asheville to 5 miles northeast of Brevard to 16 miles north of Pickens. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Rutherfordton, Columbus, Brevard, Arden, Mills River, Fletcher, Travelers Rest, Spindale and Flat Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western North Carolina...and Upstate South Carolina.
